thread.title: Bags of 'ice' worth accidentally dropped at Mount Gambier business
thread.title_full: Bags of 'ice' worth accidentally dropped at Mount Gambier business

title: Bags of 'ice' worth accidentally dropped at Mount Gambier business
text:
By Kate Hill Updated October 20, 2016 09:51:06 Map: Mount Gambier 5290 
A Mount Gambier worker has told of his shock after finding bags of the illegal drug crystal methamphetamine on the ground that police believe may have been accidentally dropped by a would-be dealer. 
The worker, who wished to remain anonymous, said he walked out of the shop on the city's main street early on Wednesday morning and found several small plastic bags full of what looked like crystals. 
"I walked out there about 7am and there it was, just lying on the ground," he said. 
"I wasn't sure what it was at first, but the police told me it was ice. I was a little bit shocked when I found out." 
Also wrapped up in the larger bag was a number of bags containing smaller amounts of the drug. 
The worker said he believed the bag had dropped from a bag or pocket when someone walked through the grounds of the business sometime the night prior. 
The man contacted Mount Gambier police, who are investigating the strange find. 
Senior Sergeant Chris King from Mount Gambier CIB said the 14 grams of methamphetamine equated to a rough street value of $7,000. 
"Police are investigating and we would like to hear from anyone who may have any information regarding this find," he said. 
Anyone information to contact local police on 0887351020 or Crimestoppers on 1800 333 000.
